column4: Hi, Since I upgraded to 9.04 I've got quite a lot of amount of crashes on my system (that is, seeing a black screen for a second, then being logged out). Have other people also complained about it since the release of 9.04?
*black screen = typical terminal with text and such.
what does it say?
- it flashes by so quickly, I can't read it
ok can you log back in again? or does it stay black?
- it goes "black" (with a lot of text), you get logged out, and I then just log in again
ok log back in and pastebin the last 100 or so lines of /var/log/messages
- here's a paste http://paste.ubuntu.com/171594/
any program you were running just before the black screen?
- not any particular, just the usual, firefox, rhythmbox and perhaps OO.org

this may cause it --> May 13 13:47:08 arash-desktop bonobo-activation-server (arash-16684): could not associate with desktop session: Failed to connect to socket /tmp/dbus-8Pd5KiDxj8: Connection refused
as how to fix it... I don't know :(
- I think I got the same problem as CosmicChaos. Mabybe it's Pidgin causing it all as CosmicChaos says
CosmicChaos I have been using pidgin and no crashes to date, I had a funny thing with BIOS that made my HD go spaz, a 160 Gig HD reporting as a 571 Gig one!
- even with 9.04?
CosmicChaos nope
CosmicChaos That made it crash with i/o errors
- well I had no problems until upgrade to 9.04
CosmicChaos sorry, yes in 9.04 but not in 8.10
- do you mean no problem on 9.04 but problem on 8.10 :S ?
no I mean I stuffed up and got my versions mixed up... 9.04 is current and I have had problems with current
- so you're experienceing crashes too ?
was, the BIOS was screwy. Since I fixed that everything has been rock solid
